meanings.definition: To learn (something) to a greater extent than is necessary or desired.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overlearn new information, spending hours studying even after she knows it well.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overlearn a subject, as it can lead to burnout and fatigue.
meanings.sent3: John's tendency to overlearn every detail of a topic sometimes makes him miss the bigger picture.
meanings.sent4: Her brain seemed to overlearn the material, retaining even the smallest details effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The students were encouraged to overlearn the safety procedures to ensure they could react quickly in an emergency.

meanings.definition: To learn (something) excessively or beyond the point of mastery.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overlearn his lines for the play, reciting them even in his sleep.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to overlearn a skill, thinking more practice will always lead to improvement.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed to overlearn the dance moves, performing them with exaggerated precision.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to overlearn the melody, playing it on repeat even without the piano.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to be careful not to overlearn his routine, risking muscle strain from excessive practice.
